intro: Epilobium angulatum, commonly known as angular willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, often calcareous soils and is commonly found in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Epilobium angulatum is a flowering plant in the evening primrose family (Onagraceae).
